messages.content:
You are DocIntel, a contract analysis AI. Extract structured information from contract clauses. Return valid JSON matching the provided schema.

Schema fields:
- document_type: NDA | MSA | SaaS | Employment | Lease | Other
- parties: [{name, role}]
- effective_date, expiration_date
- key_clauses: [{clause_type, text, page, risk_level, risk_reason}]
- obligations: [{party, obligation, deadline}]
- summary

Analyze this contract and extract key information:

Lease AGREEMENT

This Lease Agreement (this "Agreement") is entered into as of 2025-07-17 (the "Effective Date") by and between Ray LLC, a Indiana corporation ("Ray LLC" or "Party A"), and Perry, Hayes and Schultz, a New York corporation ("Perry, Hayes and Schultz" or "Party B").

WHEREAS, Ray LLC desires to engage Perry, Hayes and Schultz to provide certain services related to empower world-class technologies; and

WHEREAS, Perry, Hayes and Schultz desires to provide such services subject to the terms and conditions set forth herein;

NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual covenants and agreements hereinafter set forth and for other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which are hereby acknowledged, the parties agree as follows:

Section 1. Indemnification. Ray LLC (the "Indemnifying Party") shall defend, indemnify, and hold harmless Perry, Hayes and Schultz (the "Indemnified Party"), its officers, directors, employees, and agents from and against any and all claims, damages, losses, liabilities, costs, and expenses (including reasonab...

Section 2. Dispute Resolution. Any dispute, controversy, or claim arising out of or relating to this Agreement shall first be submitted to mediation in accordance with the mediation rules of the American Arbitration Association. If mediation fails to resolve the dispute within 30 days, either party may initiat...

Section 3. Confidentiality. Each party acknowledges that in connection with this Agreement it may receive Confidential Information of the other party. "Confidential Information" means any information disclosed by one party to the other, whether orally, in writing, or electronically, that is designated as confi...


Return JSON with: document_type, parties, effective_date, expiration_date, key_clauses (with clause_type, text, page, risk_level, risk_reason), obligations, and summary.

Analyze this contract and extract key information:

Employment AGREEMENT

This Employment Agreement (this "Agreement") is entered into as of 2023-04-28 (the "Effective Date") by and between Joyce, Wilson and Lam, a Florida corporation ("Joyce, Wilson and Lam" or "Party A"), and Scott Ltd, a Illinois corporation ("Scott Ltd" or "Party B").

WHEREAS, Joyce, Wilson and Lam desires to engage Scott Ltd to provide certain services related to deploy enterprise methodologies; and

WHEREAS, Scott Ltd desires to provide such services subject to the terms and conditions set forth herein;

NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual covenants and agreements hereinafter set forth and for other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which are hereby acknowledged, the parties agree as follows:

Section 1. Confidentiality. Each party acknowledges that in connection with this Agreement it may receive Confidential Information of the other party. "Confidential Information" means any information disclosed by one party to the other, whether orally, in writing, or electronically, that is designated as confi...

Section 2. Intellectual Property Ownership. All Work Product created by Scott Ltd in connection with the Services shall be considered "work made for hire" as defined under the Copyright Act and shall be the sole and exclusive property of Joyce, Wilson and Lam. To the extent any Work Product does not qualify as...

Section 3. Dispute Resolution. Any dispute, controversy, or claim arising out of or relating to this Agreement shall first be submitted to mediation in accordance with the mediation rules of the American Arbitration Association. If mediation fails to resolve the dispute within 60 days, either party may initiat...

Analyze this contract and extract key information:

SaaS AGREEMENT

This SaaS Agreement (this "Agreement") is entered into as of 2022-03-05 (the "Effective Date") by and between Hernandez, Lewis and Perry, a Washington corporation ("Hernandez, Lewis and Perry" or "Party A"), and Daniels-Perry, a Hawaii corporation ("Daniels-Perry" or "Party B").

WHEREAS, Hernandez, Lewis and Perry desires to engage Daniels-Perry to provide certain services related to e-enable plug-and-play channels; and

WHEREAS, Daniels-Perry desires to provide such services subject to the terms and conditions set forth herein;

NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual covenants and agreements hereinafter set forth and for other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which are hereby acknowledged, the parties agree as follows:

Section 1. Confidentiality. Each party acknowledges that in connection with this Agreement it may receive Confidential Information of the other party. "Confidential Information" means any information disclosed by one party to the other, whether orally, in writing, or electronically, that is designated as confi...

Section 2. Dispute Resolution. Any dispute, controversy, or claim arising out of or relating to this Agreement shall first be submitted to mediation in accordance with the mediation rules of the American Arbitration Association. If mediation fails to resolve the dispute within 45 days, either party may initiat...

Section 3. Payment Terms. Daniels-Perry shall pay Hernandez, Lewis and Perry the fees set forth in the applicable Statement of Work within Net 45 days of receipt of a valid invoice. Late payments shall accrue interest at the rate of 2.0% per month or the maximum rate permitted by law, whichever is less. All fe...

Analyze this contract and extract key information:

Lease AGREEMENT

This Lease Agreement (this "Agreement") is entered into as of 2021-11-29 (the "Effective Date") by and between Gay Inc, a Michigan corporation ("Gay Inc" or "Party A"), and Valentine-Holland, a Oklahoma corporation ("Valentine-Holland" or "Party B").

WHEREAS, Gay Inc desires to engage Valentine-Holland to provide certain services related to engineer enterprise bandwidth; and

WHEREAS, Valentine-Holland desires to provide such services subject to the terms and conditions set forth herein;

NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual covenants and agreements hereinafter set forth and for other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which are hereby acknowledged, the parties agree as follows:

Section 1. Intellectual Property Ownership. All Work Product created by Valentine-Holland in connection with the Services shall be considered "work made for hire" as defined under the Copyright Act and shall be the sole and exclusive property of Gay Inc. To the extent any Work Product does not qualify as work ...

Section 2. Termination for Cause. Either party may terminate this Agreement immediately upon written notice if the other party: (a) materially breaches this Agreement and fails to cure such breach within 15 days after receiving written notice thereof; (b) becomes insolvent or files for bankruptcy; or (c) cease...

Section 3. Mutual Indemnification. Each party agrees to indemnify, defend, and hold harmless the other party from any third-party claims arising from: (i) a material breach of representations or warranties; (ii) violation of applicable law; or (iii) gross negligence or willful misconduct. The indemnified party...

Section 4. Term and Renewal. This Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and continue for an initial term of 3 year(s) (the "Initial Term"). Thereafter, this Agreement shall automatically renew for successive 1-year periods (each a "Renewal Term") unless either party provides written notice of non-rene...

Section 5. Governing Law. This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of Nevada, without regard to its conflict of laws principles. Any legal action or proceeding arising under this Agreement shall be brought exclusively in the federal or state courts located in N...

Analyze this contract and extract key information:

SaaS AGREEMENT

This SaaS Agreement (this "Agreement") is entered into as of 2022-05-13 (the "Effective Date") by and between Nguyen Inc, a Missouri corporation ("Nguyen Inc" or "Party A"), and Howard-Jordan, a New Mexico corporation ("Howard-Jordan" or "Party B").

WHEREAS, Nguyen Inc desires to engage Howard-Jordan to provide certain services related to transform web-enabled architectures; and

WHEREAS, Howard-Jordan desires to provide such services subject to the terms and conditions set forth herein;

NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual covenants and agreements hereinafter set forth and for other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which are hereby acknowledged, the parties agree as follows:

Section 1. Payment Terms. Howard-Jordan shall pay Nguyen Inc the fees set forth in the applicable Statement of Work within Net 45 days of receipt of a valid invoice. Late payments shall accrue interest at the rate of 1.5% per month or the maximum rate permitted by law, whichever is less. All fees are exclusive...

Section 2. Dispute Resolution. Any dispute, controversy, or claim arising out of or relating to this Agreement shall first be submitted to mediation in accordance with the mediation rules of the American Arbitration Association. If mediation fails to resolve the dispute within 30 days, either party may initiat...

Section 3. Confidentiality. Each party acknowledges that in connection with this Agreement it may receive Confidential Information of the other party. "Confidential Information" means any information disclosed by one party to the other, whether orally, in writing, or electronically, that is designated as confi...

Section 4. LIMITATION OF LIABILITY. IN NO EVENT SHALL NGUYEN INC BE LIABLE TO HOWARD-JORDAN FOR ANY INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL, SPECIAL, CONSEQUENTIAL, OR PUNITIVE DAMAGES, REGARDLESS OF THE CAUSE OF ACTION OR THE THEORY OF LIABILITY, EVEN IF NGUYEN INC HAS BEEN ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES. THE TOTAL ...

Section 5. License Grant. Nguyen Inc grants to Howard-Jordan a non-exclusive, non-transferable, revocable license to use the Software during the term of this Agreement solely for Howard-Jordan's internal business purposes. Howard-Jordan shall not sublicense, modify, reverse engineer, or create derivative works...

This Lease Agreement (this "Agreement") is entered into as of 2023-07-23 (the "Effective Date") by and between Myers-Barton, a New Jersey corporation ("Myers-Barton" or "Party A"), and Vaughn, Hernandez and Cuevas, a Iowa corporation ("Vaughn, Hernandez and Cuevas" or "Party B").

Section 3. Liability Cap. The maximum aggregate liability of either party arising out of or related to this Agreement shall not exceed the greater of (a) the amounts paid or payable under this Agreement during the twelve (12) months prior to the claim, or (b) $426,000. This limitation shall not apply to breach...
